ranges.1he: Your palm is sweaty. Maybe you will improve.
ranges.2h: My that weapon is heavy! You lose the opportunity to take a swing.
ranges.pa: You snag your own clothes and lose the opportunity to take a swing.
ranges.mounted: Your mount's tack tangles your weapon. You lose the opportunity to take a strike.
ranges.th: Your grip is weak. You elect not to attack because of control.
ranges.mis: Sweat trickles into your eye. You elect not to attack. Good choice.

ranges.1he: Klutzy. Drop your weapon. Spend two rounds recovering it; or draw a new one next round.
ranges.2h: Your weapon flies. Take four rounds to recover it; or draw a new one next round.
ranges.pa: Fumble your delivery and your weapon is out of position. You lose the option to attack.
ranges.mounted: Can't find the right angle. You lose 2 rounds of attack (but can still parry).
ranges.th: You fumble your delivery but hang onto your weapon. You have -10 to your next attack.
ranges.mis: Your ten thumbs just cannot handle loading. You must reload your weapon.

ranges.1he: Your feet get tangled. You miss the opportunity to get in that vital blow.
ranges.2h: Your mind is wandering. Spend the rest of the round clearing your head.
ranges.pa: You just look clumsy. Your feet are sliding. You are stunned for one round.
ranges.mounted: You slip in the saddle. You lose 2 rounds of attack (but can still parry).
ranges.th: Your feet are really tangled up. You lose 2 rounds of attack, but can still parry.
ranges.mis: Your ammunition slips away. You must reload.

ranges.1he: You are over-extended and strain a muscle. Take 1d5 hits.
ranges.2h: Stumble over an imaginary dead turtle. You lose 2 rounds of attack, but you can still parry.
ranges.pa: Your weapon is spinning for two rounds. You can still parry at -10.
ranges.mounted: Your mount dodges an unseen foe. You are stunned for 2 rounds.
ranges.th: You begin juggling your weapon because of a bad grip. Your lack of control stuns you for 3 rounds.
ranges.mis: You notice that your ammunition is faulty. After removing it you discover you were wrong. Reload it.

ranges.1he: You try to impress your opponent with a spin maneuver. Too bad. Lose two rounds while you recover.
ranges.2h: Your combination of acrobatics and attacks is unimpressive. Lose two rounds of attacks, but you can still parry.
ranges.pa: You stagger into a nearby fixed object. You are stunned and unable to parry for two rounds.
ranges.mounted: You lose your grip on your weapon. Luckily, it is tangled in your mount's tack. Your lack of grace stuns you for three rounds.
ranges.th: Poor release. Weapon travels 2d10 feet to the left of the target.
ranges.mis: Your ammunition keeps jumping off of your weapon! Try melee next time.

ranges.1he: You snag your clothes with your weapon, causing it to slip from your hand. Spend two rounds juggling it.
ranges.2h: Your weapon flies from your hands, but you are able to catch it before it flies totally away. Lose two rounds of attack.
ranges.pa: Your shaft tangles in your legs. You almost fall down in an impressive feat of entangling. Your next attack is at -20.
ranges.mounted: Your poor mount stumbles. You are stunned for two rounds.
ranges.th: Very poor release sends your weapon straight up! You duck for cover while your weapon checks for breakage.
ranges.mis: Your weapon slips from your hands. Spend two rounds recovering it; or draw a new weapon.

ranges.1he: You execute a perfect attack—against closest ally (yourself if no one else is around). Ally takes 1d10 hits and a 'B' critical.
ranges.2h: Acrobatic maneuver leaves you flat on your back. Take 2d10 hits and an 'E' Krush critical.
ranges.pa: Your weapon must check for breakage as you slam it into the ground! You are stunned for six rounds because of the impact.
ranges.mounted: Your swing slices the tack of your mount. You and your saddle take your leave of the poor beast. Take an 'A' Krush critical.
ranges.th: Your ferocious scream is followed by silence as you hit yourself. Take a 'D' Krush critical.
ranges.mis: Take an 'A' Krush critical from the sudden release. Your weapon snaps cleanly into two pieces.

ranges.1he: You trip over that uneven surface. Spend two rounds staggering. You can still parry.
ranges.2h: You gracefully drop your weapon to the ground. You are able to kick it back into your hand, but you lose two rounds while doing it.
ranges.pa: Your weapon seems to have a mind of its own! Your next attack is at -50 as you try and get it under control.
ranges.mounted: Your tack has loosened! You suddenly slip sideways. You are stunned for two rounds.
ranges.th: You cannot control your aim—your weapon flies 2d10 feet to the right of the intended target.
ranges.mis: Your grip fails and your weapon flies from your hands. Spend two rounds recovering it; or draw a new weapon.

ranges.1he: You are distracted by that pixie in the corner. You lose 2 rounds of attacks.
ranges.2h: You strain your shoulders in a mighty swing (that misses). You are stunned for two rounds.
ranges.pa: Your ineptitude is obvious to all. You lose 3 rounds of attacks and are stunned for 2 rounds.
ranges.mounted: Your weapon goes straight into the ground (check for breakage).
ranges.th: Just as you are about to release, you step into an imaginary hole in the ground. Lose 3 rounds getting up from the ground.
ranges.mis: Your bowstring breaks! Draw a new weapon or put a new string on this one.

ranges.1he: You are suddenly very winded. Take two rounds to relax.
ranges.2h: You lose your grip as you begin your swing. Your weapon is trying to slip away. Spend three rounds gaining control. You can still parry.
ranges.pa: Clumsy move narrowly misses your own head. You are stunned and unable to parry for three rounds (try a bow next time).
ranges.mounted: Your weapon flies out of your hand! Draw a new one.
ranges.th: Your weapon drops to the ground as you begin to aim. Take four rounds to recover this one; or draw a new one.
ranges.mis: Your weapon bites back when you fire. Your shot misses everything, but you are stunned and unable to parry for three rounds.

ranges.1he: Hopefully, you will learn that dancing is not appropriate in combat. You are stunned for two rounds by your lack of ability.
ranges.2h: You pulled something on that last swing and now it begins to hurt! You are stunned for three rounds while you recover.
ranges.pa: There it goes! Your weapon skitters away. Take six rounds to recover it; or draw a new one.
ranges.mounted: Your weapon must check for breakage as it hits the hardest part of your foe. You take 2d10 hits from the blast.
ranges.th: Your poor and weak release sends the weapon up two feet. It immediately comes down and hits you. You take no damage, but are stunned for six rounds.
ranges.mis: You release too soon! Your arrow falls 3d10 feet short of the target. In addition, you spend two rounds trying to find more ammunition.

ranges.1he: You fall down as your swing goes wide. You are stunned for three rounds.
ranges.2h: You fall and narrowly miss gutting yourself! You are stunned for four rounds.
ranges.pa: You fall and smack your head on the ground. You are down for four rounds and stunned for three.
ranges.mounted: Your mount bucks unexpectedly just as you were about to swing. You find yourself stunned and unable to parry for three rounds.
ranges.th: Your weapon flies behind you, travelling 4d10 feet before landing.
ranges.mis: Your shot goes astray as you slip and fall during your release. You are stunned for six rounds and unable to parry for two rounds.

ranges.1he: The excitement is just too much! Your momentary frenzy leaves you stunned and unable to parry for three rounds.
ranges.2h: You trip and fall. You are down for four rounds and unable to parry for three.
ranges.pa: Your shoulder doesn't bend that way! You are stunned and unable to parry for three rounds. You now fight at -25.
ranges.mounted: Your mount jumps wildly. You take 4d10 hits from the impact and are stunned and unable to parry for six rounds.
ranges.th: You trip as you release. Your shot goes off wildly and you are stunned for twelve rounds.
ranges.mis: Your weapon shatters (as you don't realize your own strength)! You are stunned for 4 rounds.

ranges.1he: You attempt to maim yourself. Take a 'D' critical.
ranges.2h: Worst move seen in ages! You are out for 2 days with a groin injury. There is a 50% chance your foes will be out for 3 rounds, laughing.
ranges.pa: Your weapon breaks and one end hits you in the head. You are stunned and unable to parry for six rounds.
ranges.mounted: You can't stay on your mount! You fall and take a 'D' crush critical.
ranges.th: You accidentally hit yourself in the delivery. Take a 'D' Krush critical.
ranges.mis: Poor execution. You take 5 hits as the weapon hits you. You are permanently maimed and are bleeding 2 hits per round.
